Topic.Title: Intel opens up about its "Knight's Corner" parallel superputing coprocessor

Message.Msg: . . So Best? If Intel's new Xeon Phi (Knight's Bridge) co-processor gets 9% more MFLOPS/Watt than the aging, energy wasting nvidia Tesla, why on Earth would any supercomputer builder use the nvidia Tesla? Times tens of thousands of chips -- why -- that's a fortune wasted on electricity. Needlessly. I think future supercomputers will use Intel's Xeon Phi co-processor chips instead. Heck, maybe they'll retro-fit the old ones too. For a 9% savings in electricity. Probably pays for the new energy-efficient Intel chips in no time at all, right? . .

Message.Msg: 9 PERCENT? LOL NO ROTFLOL NINE PERCENT? You're crowing about single digit percentages improvement? Intel's been working on that POS since 2008, Now they're ready to debut it and it's only 9% faster than NVIDIA's current part? FOUR YEARS FOR SINGLE DIGITS? ha hah ahhahahha Are you a complete idiot? Haven't you heard the first thing the incredibly well informed longs have been posting here about that 64-bit ARM processor processor NVDIA and ARMH are working on? That part will put the MFLOPs per watt metric to bed forever. For Intel. Done, over and OUT, Your need to check your facts, Intel is toast. Quit spewing garbage.

Topic.Title: Intel opens up about its "Knight's Corner" parallel superputing coprocessor

Message.Msg: . . "9% percent better MFlops/Watt... compared to Fermi", writes getanid61, deceptively. . Sorry, you're wrong. Look at the benchmarks chart again pal. Google this: "Intel opens up about its 'Knights Corner' supercomputer co-processor" What's it say on the shorter green bar? Hummm? "Nvidia Tesla 2090" That is not a Fermi chip now is it? No it isn't. If it was a Fermi chip it would be called GeForce GTX___. And what idiot would put a Locked double precision floating point chip in a supercomputer anyway? . The new Intel Xeon Phi (Knight's Corner) co-processor handily beats nvidia's best Tesla 2090 chip by a whopping 9% more MFLOPS/Watt. Which is Enormous in a supercomputer with tens of thousands of co-processor chips. Looks like you've been bested, boys. By Intel. . .

Topic.Title: One upgrade and one downgrade on the eve of Amazon announcement

Message.Msg: NVDA) awakened the world to the power of computer graphics when it invented the GPU in 1999. Since then, it has consistently set new standards in visual computing with breathtaking, interactive graphics available on devices ranging from tablets and mobile phones to notebooks and workstations. NVIDIA's expertise in programmable GPUs has led to breakthroughs in parallel processing which make . supercomputing inexpensive and widely accessible. DENVER in 2014 as a long range goal/ . Momentum has accelerated With media tablet sales to end users believed to reach 110 million units this year and cross 220 million unit by 2016, there is huge potential for growth in the market. GOOGLE and MSFT wins- With Tegra 3 processors being present in Microsoft’s Surface PC tablet as well, we feel the company will leverage from the growth in both these operating systems. The Company holds more than 1,900 issued patents worldwide, including ones covering designs and insights that are essential to modern computing . This company is probably the best positioned chip maker in the market right now. The potential and pipeline for earnings /estimates have been increasing rapidly. Tegra 3 revenues increased by almost 50% in Q1 2012 and Nvidia expects the shipment to almost double in 2012. The company also hasn't had a negative earnings surprise in over two years. SEPT 1 news reports- It’s widely expected that Amazon will drop Texas Instruments (NYSE: TXN ) for the tablet’s processing brains, and that NVIDIA (Nasdaq: NVDA ) has scored that seat with its quad-core Tegra 3 chip -- the same one powering the Nexus 7. The display should get upgraded from the current 1024 x 600, and match the Nexus 7’s resolution of 1280 x 800. We may see a camera added, while the first-generation model lacked one. Unlike Apple’s supply chain, which is full of leaks, not much else is known about Amazon’s new device. The FIRE is selling out and Amazon is out of stock. NVDA WINS WITH A 199$ PRICE RANGE. The Nexus 7 carries Android 4.1 Jelly Bean, and the Google Play content storefront. Amazon should, again, use a heavily modified, or forked, version of Android, but it remains to be seen which version it might have tinkered with. Google definitely has an advantage in apps, but Amazon has an enormous selection of books and movies. Amazon has come a long way since the dawn of the Internet, and is now a dominant force in cyberspace. Smartphones are the largest market for mobile appli¬cation processors, with shipments on track for 670 million units and a growth rate of 37% in 2012. Shipments of tablet computers are expanding even faster, with a pro¬jected 77% growth in 2012 to 113 million units. NVIDIA (Nasdaq: NVDA ) may have had a first-mover advantage with its quad-core Tegra 3,

Topic.Title: Back to $14 on Thursday

Message.Msg: Many pundits will say that Nvidia doesn’t stand a chance against bigger rivals like Qualcomm which makes the Snapdragon processor, Apple’s A5 chip, or Intel’s Atom chip. The true story is not only does Tegra 3 compete with these, it’s beating them in most benchmark test. And let me warn you Qualcomm, Apple, and Intel, the beating is only going to get worse. I have seen this story before, once Nvidia gets the edge it maintains it. The launch of Tegra 3 accelerated Nvidia’s revenue contribution from its consumer products business, showing a 36% sequential increase last quarter to just over $179 million. Those record sales of Tegra 3 processors last quarter will continue, as Nvidia has had a number of big design wins lately, most notably Google’s Nexus 7, the world’s first $199 quad-core 7-inch tablet, and Microsoft’s Windows RT Surface tablet. So we have two parts to Nvidia now. It’s not just a graphics chip company anymore, as it has a growing mobile computing business as well, which could become larger than its core graphics business in the future The success of Tegra 3 as well as a rebound in its GPU business translated into blowout earnings last quarter, with EPS coming in at 27 cents vs estimates of 15 cents. For the current quarter, the company expects revenue of $1.15 billion to $1.25 billion, the average estimates of analysts was $1.09 billion. Nvidia’s core business is going to be fine, and they will be widely successful in mobile computing as well. Most gamers don’t go to that extreme, but they still want a high performance graphics card for their pc. Nvidia’s current market cap is $9 billion, and they have almost $3.3 billion in cash and no debt. Given the earnings guidance, the company’s EPS should be about $1 for the year, giving it a current p/e of 14. Considering the growth of Tegra 3, and the company’s market share position in graphics, next year earnings could be blowouts, possible $1.50 a share or more for the year. Diversifying- Nvidia knows that tablets and smartphones are only going to become more popular, and who better than to make a central processing unit (CPU), graphics processing unit (GPU), northbridge, southbridge, and memory controller onto one package to go into these devices? Don’t be fooled by the market that don’t get NVDA or understand it. The true story is not only does Tegra 3 compete with these, it’s beating them in most benchmark test. And let me warn you Qualcomm, Apple, and Intel, the beating is only going to get worse. I have seen this story before, once Nvidia gets the edge it maintains it. "I think that we will see some shipments [of GeForce Grid and VGX] this year, but I would expect that most of these servers will go-to-market and ramp next year, in Q1 of next year.

Topic.Title: Back to $14 on Thursday

Message.Msg: Worst is over!- On the profit front, NVIDIA reported non-GAAP earnings oft 27 cents per share compared to 16 cents per share for the same quarter last year. Analysts forecast earnings of 22 cents per share. Better outlook- Generally speaking, the company’s chips sales outside of the PC market appears to be boosting revenue. Sales in this area will likely be critical to the company going forward, as global PC sales appear to be waning, so says noted research firm Gartner. NVIDIA's Tegra series chips will be featured in both Microsoft's (Nasdaq: MSFT) upcoming Surface Windows RT tablet PC and are already featured in Google's (Nasdaq: GOOG) Nexus 7 tablet. In addition, investors might keep an eye on new cloud computing technologies, which NVIDIA announced at its recent GPI Technology Conference SALES RECORDS- "Our investments in mobile computing and visual computing are both paying off," said Jen-Hsun Huang, president and chief executive officer of NVIDIA. "Tegra has achieved record sales as tablets come into their own. Our GPU business made strong gains in a weak market, boosted by our breakthrough Kepler architecture. Looking ahead, we're optimistic, as our investments position us right at the center of the fastest growing segments of computing." FUTURE PROOF- Nvidia’s Grid and VGX cloud graphics processors enable gamer-grade or professional-grade graphics capabilities on absolutely any device, including desktops, laptops, tablets or even smartphones. 100% - Without doubts, cloud graphics processing technologies are among the most important technologies Nvidia has ever developed. However, it will take some time before they will be adopted by the mass market. The key technologies powering the new platform are Nvidia GeForce Grid GPUs with dedicated ultra-low-latency streaming technology and cloud graphics software. Together, they fundamentally change the economics and experience of cloud gaming, enabling gaming-as-a-service providers to operate scalable data centers at costs that are in line with those of movie-streaming services. Gaikai will be the first Nvidia customer to adopt GeForce Grid MULTI MEDIA- Fast streaming technology reduces server latency to as little as 10 milliseconds by capturing and encoding a game frame in a single pass. The GeForce Grid platform uses fast-frame capture, concurrent rendering and single-pass encoding to achieve ultra-fast game streaming.

Topic.Title: Back to $14 on Thursday

Message.Msg: I FEEL there are enough variables with the competition to look at this stock very hard. IF INTC or QCOM stumble at all it could be a windfall. The digital marketplace and different industries going digital warrant a position. The company has been an industry leader branching out to high growth segments. NVDA built world’s first dual-core graphics processor, the Tegra 2, and that’s what we’re shipping today. And now we’re working on first quad-core processor will be Tegra 3, which is really going to be called Kal-El. Huang notes that Kal-El is Superman name, and that the rest of the product line up is also comics-based: “Wayne” for Bat-Man, etc. Anyway: Getting performance is easy part. Challenging part is delivering that performance with low power, and better and better efficiency. The low-power core with Kal-El is 20x “less hungry” for energy. Second invention: Use image-processing technique to look at the color content of an image. That allows us to save a ton of power that way. It allows us to sort of “cheat” on colors and use similar colors, with different lighting – human eye can’t tell. having the first step advantage into the quad core speeks for itself. Huang: We’re in about 70 percent of non-iPad tablets. 13 models of phones around the world. I have seem the stock bounce to many times to think its staying down here....

This could be the big volume bottom everyones looking for. Long @ the 50day. Seems to me NVDA is the best in class. But oh that's right I forgot PC's won't be made anymore , duh kenn and alot of antacid today. :-)

Message.Title: where is support?
Message.Msg: NVDA is being traded like a 2-bit social networking company. NVDA should put their cash horde to some use - either start a massive buy back or, start a dividend. Best they do both. and what is with the QCOM love affair, NVDA is trashed day in day out regardless of their market lead. Now Snapdragon is all the rage and Tegra is yesterday's story. I am quite sure that NVDA did not get in Amazon Fire 2, otherwise there would have been a bottom around 13.70

Message.Title: Look at them making excuses for Nvidia
Message.Msg: They spent their time bashing Apple as it added over $400 and praising Jen as Nvidia went from $26 to $13. Nvidia is a JUNK And anyone who paid over $16 regrets it so they spend their days on a message board whinning and making excuses for wasting good money on JUNK. They blame the analyst, so called bashers, traders, PC rags, consumer spending, China, Europe and TSMC because Nvidia went from $26 to $13. While Apple went from $300s to $600s Nvidia is JUNK and who told you to buy JUNK. imho

Topic.Title: where is support?

Message.Msg: truly exasperating - management has delivered, but wall street is singing a different tune. the only thing to do now is put cash to work - hoping that CEO/CFO can see the value in their own stock rather than putting money in bank collecting dust.

Message.Title: how can we take tyhe suckas!
Message.Msg: Same ol, same ol. Use the message board to hammer the stock and get a couple of shill analysts to downgrade, just before some possible good news is expected and you get rid of all the people that bought on margin or put stop losses on their stock. Same game played over and over again. Add to that some "naked shorting" and the stock looks like ( as one hedge fund flunky said ) junk. Over and over again and if the company itself doesn't declare war then the hedgies get away with it. Wish the SEC would get a few more wire taps to see how many of the hegies and funds are talking with each other and setting up game time tables. I love it when some idiot legislator says the playing field is level. If you believe that then I have a nice clean bridge in Brooklyn you might be interested in.

Message.Title: P-athetic Anal-yst
Message.Msg: Downgraded due to "choppy revenue outlook" - how lame. The PC biz and the gaming biz are not the same thing, besides Nvidia outgrew the PC biz in the Gaming Graphics segment significantly and forecasted to continue to do that. The same anal-yst did not downgrade all semis - which is very odd. If anything Nvidia is the only company to forecast A SIGNIFICANT REVENUE GROWTH GOING FORWARD compared with all other semis - AND HAVE WINS TO PROVE IT - BRING ON THE FIRE AND THE N73G AND DESTROY THESE anal-yst WITH THE SURFACE RT ARMS! They have an agenda - it's obvious - probably still nursing a bruised ego inflicted by Jen at a conference sometime back :) Grow up and move on - good things will happen.

Topic.Title: P-athetic Anal-yst

Message.Msg: Exactly buddy, company's own pipeline tells how much business they have for the current quarter and they guided revenue that beat analyst' estimate by a good margin. So, the only agenda in that "Choppy outlook" downgrade is to pressurize the stock price his company and entire family can buy it before several major catalyst events. Thats all I can think about. comments welcome

(- 5.38%) __ nvidia . Oh my! My my my. How to explain this do-it-yourself investing screw-up to the current bride, right boys? And you thought raging blue rhinos were bad..... . . .

Topic.Title: NVDA Down, But Now Not the Time to Sell

Message.Msg: . . "I did a search today. Both have had SEC investigations in their past ... alway looks suspicious", writes ibexx88. . Well, Best did a search today too. Into the SEC's investigation of nvidia's past accounting charades. Oh yes -- the SEC investigated whether nvidia was cookin' the books. Or did you boys conveniently forget? Hummm? Here. Best doesn't make this stuff up, u know. Google on: "SEC investigation into NVidia centers on Xbox: Analyst . 19 February, 2002 "A U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) investigation into transactions conducted by graphics-chip maker NVidia likely focuses on how the company accounted for costs associated with its development of graphics chips for Microsoft's Xbox game console, a financial analyst said Friday. On Feb. 14, NVidia officials revealed that the SEC has begun an investigation into how the company recorded reserves during the fourth quarter of its 2000 fiscal year and the first quarter of fiscal 2001. In addition, the SEC is investigating the possibility that US$3.6 million in product costs should have been recorded by the company during the first quarter of fiscal 2001, but were instead recorded during the second and third quarters of that same year, the company said. NVidia's fiscal 2000 year ended January 30, 2000 and its fiscal 2001 year ended January 28, 2001. During a conference call with analysts on Feb. 14, Jen-Hsun Huang, NVidia's chief executive officer (CEO) and president, declined to comment on specifics of the SEC investigation, including the nature of the reserves under investigation." . Always looks suspicious, right boys? It sure does. . So do you want to know how the SEC investigation into nvidia's accounting ended? Hummm? Okay. But first an important warning. WARNING: Do not Google the following link if you are a NVDA long still in denial, have high blood pressure, a heart condition or are under the care of a physician. Shorts should contact your doctor or seek emergency medical attention if your erection is painful or lasts longer than 4 hours. Okay -- Here's how the 2002 SEC investigation of nvidia's accounting turned out. Google this: "NVIDIA Announces Conclusion of SEC Investigation" . Did I mention? "Always looks suspicious", right boys? . .

Topic.Title: NVDA Down, But Now Not the Time to Sell

Message.Msg: . . Here's what appears to have happened. ibexx88 posted something slanderous-looking about two funds and past SEC investigations. He called them by name -- maybe not so smart when you are likely slandering them on a global venue. Anyway, the fine Yahoo Monitors apparently immediately removed ibexx88's message from view. Without leaving an "X" or anything -- like on the good old board. Meanwhile, best.here was doing his exhaustive on-line research into the SEC's 2002 investigation into nvidia's investigatable accounting. And by the time best.here posted his diligent research -- ibexx88's slanderous-looking message had already been wisked-away from public view. Resulting in this mighty puzzling-looking thread. With best.here quoting a message from ibexx88 -- which has been deleted by the Monitors. . .
